1.content:
Welcome to the Ibis Tree.


I ask that you take all that's written, leave what is not,
Begin golden voyages, undiscovered ports await,
Inspire travelling artists to wade deep through your thought,
Sow the seeds of intrigue for new life to germinate!

In this brief introduction I shall try and answer as many questions as possible about this project starting with:-

What is a "branchology"?


A branchology is a portmanteau comprising of the words "branching" and "anthology"; each choice(branch) leads to a new story by a new author.

What is the purpose of The Ibis Tree?


The Ibis Tree was created to both challenge and index talented genre authors on writing.com. Authors get to write a short story to promote their portfolio, whilst readers get a chance to happen across a new writer that they may have missed on this site.

Why is this calledThe Ibis Tree?


The namesake for this project comes from the Ancient Egyptian deity Thoth who was commonly depicted as having the head of an Ibis(although later depictions tell of him having the head of a baboon.)

Thoth was the god of the moon, magic, writing and wisdom.

Him being the scribe of the gods, the inventor of writing, and the author of every branch of knowledge, both human and divine, make him the perfect namesake for this project.

Why should I contribute a story?


To demonstrate your skills and further promote your portfolio.

What should I write in the choice boxes?


Please write the word Story followed by a number corresponding to the choice.

E.g. Story 1, Story 2, etc.

Where should I start?


There are two paths that you can choose here.

Option A:-          Click the Story Outline and find a title that intrigues you.

Option B:-          Choose a genre and explore!

Genres
These definitions are rough at best. If you have any ideas for alternative definitions, please feel free to email me.
1.title: The Ibis Tree Mission

11.content:
Definition:-

         Any fiction which induces feelings of horror, terror or disgust by shock or frightening the reader's sensibilities.

Scary stories only beyond this point.
11.title: Horror

111.content:
She is awake.

There is something different about this one.

Normally when they awaken, alone in this empty, locked room with only a camera and a light on the high ceiling, they scream, hit at the door and curse in panic, but this one is calm.

She sits in the middle of the room cross-legged and stares up at the camera, at me.

Has she been here before?

Does she know what is about to happen, because I don't.

My place is to observe and obey, not to question them, though this woman makes me surprisingly curious.

Her blue-eyed stare bores straight through to the very depth of my being.

Who is this lady?

She seems so familiar.

When I picked her up from the bus station, she looked like a gypsy, a long free-flowing red dress accented by golden greenery, barefoot, with low hanging brass earrings.

I pricked her back with my syringe before covering her mouth, she didn't struggle even then.

The next time I see them, I must ask.

In the monitor, her large brown eye still stay on me; wait, brown eyes?

A moment ago her eyes were the most piercing shade of blue, weren't they?

Is this a test?

Her eyes couldn't have changed hue like that.

She is standing up, I don't like this.

They should hear about this, I know that I should call them, but some part of me wants to see what she will do next.

Is she waving to me?

Oh, she flinched, they are at the door.

The thick reinforced door swings open, just as it should; two large beings wearing gas masks and boiler-suits enter, just as they should; they shut the door and the yellow gas starts filling the room, again, just as usual.

Why is the feed still playing?

This is not normal.

Once the gas pours in, the feed should end, that's the way that it has been since they recruited me.

I am not usually privy to what happens next; I do my part and I'm paid, I don't ask questions.

This is their way.

What has changed?

Something is wrong.

My hand shoots for my phone, I call them.

It rings, then nothing.

The yellow gas sucks out of the room, clearing the feed, she is alone, in the same place, still staring at me.

Where are the boiler suits?

Nobody is picking up.

I guess I'll go down to the room and wait for someone to arrive.

Wait, what is she holding?

It looks like a tennis ball, but the video keeps going out of focus.

She throws it at the camera and the feed cuts out.

I know for a fact that there was nothing left in the room, apart from the blue medical-robe that I dressed her in, a camera and a light bulb.

Maybe one of the boiler suits gave her something.

I pocket my phone, run and open my front door.

My door swings wide open, hitting me in the jaw and knocking me to the floor.

She is here.

There's no way that she could be, but she is.

She holds what looks like a furry grey bowling ball; this ball is larger than the one on the feed.

I lie back on the carpet, she walks around me and holds the ball over my face.

Her almond-green eyes reassure me that this is the way that things are now.

Not their way, the way of all things.
111.title: They are not, not anymore

12.content:
Definition:-

         "What if?" stories whose common themes include space, the future, alien races and technology.

         Sci-Fi commonly has at least some basis in the realm of real-world science.

If you are still unsure please post under the Speculative Fiction genre.
12.title: Sci-Fi

13.content:
Definition:-

         Tales involving a puzzle or crime to be solved.

For true sleuths only.
13.title: Mystery

14.content:
Definition:-

         A genre in which the plot could not happen in real life.

         A departure from accepted rules by which we perceive the world around us.

         Stories involving magic in the world and magic within ourselves.

Adventure awaits.
14.title: Fantasy

15.content:
Definition:-

         An umbrella genre, covering all stories that include supernatural or futuristic elements.

Basically, if your story doesn't fit into the other four categories, it goes here.
15.title: Speculative Fiction

info.description:
What is The Ibis Tree?


The Ibis Tree is a branching flash-fiction anthology of genre shorts written by the WDC Community

Its purpose is to be a living, constantly growing archive of short stories by many talented genre writers, so as to expose as many folk as possible to writers that they otherwise may have overlooked.

A communal story hub for fantastical visionaries and spectators alike.

Genres include:-

          Horror

          Sci-Fi

          Mystery

          Fantasy

          Speculative Fiction



The Rules


1:-          Nothing above an 18+ rating.

2:-          Original works only.

3:-          One short story per chapter.

4:-          One chapter per person.

5:-          Add at least three choices at the end of your chapter.

6:-          Add your story to the appropriate genre path.

Any failure to comply with these rules will result in a warning email which may then be followed by your chapter being deleted.


Feel free to contact me with any questions.

If you are interested, you can read more about The Ibis Tree's mission in the first chapter.
